channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023100221
item.description:
Report X-2023100221

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The wet package was discovered during unload. It was immediately isolated and placed in the Hazmat cage for safe-keeping until after the inbound sort. DescribePack: Apparently the package continued to leak from its cap or a puncture, after it was placed in double-wrapped plastic bags in California prior to being shipped back to Des Moines. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Hands were washed which came into contact with the wet box. An absorbing solid was used to soak-up the standing liquid in the trailer.

item.title: Report E-2023100793
item.description:
Report E-2023100793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon pails of Kleanstrip (un1090) releasing 1 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
